intro: Crotalaria angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf cowpea, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features slender, branching stems and alternate, narrow, ovate leaves with a pointed tip. The plant produces distinctive yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by pod-like fruits containing kidney-shaped seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Crotalaria angustifolia is noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it a valuable plant in agricultural systems.
